questions.question: Q1. What is the time complexity of kosaraju's algorithm? Assume the graph has n vertices and m edges.

explanations.a: The algorithm is a DFS based algorithm. The first DFS takes O(n+m) time, the second DFS takes O(n+m) time and the reversing the graph also takes O(n+m) time. So total time is O(n+m).

questions.question: Q2. What is the space complexity of kosaraju's algorithm? Assume the graph has n vertices and m edges. Do not consider the space required to store the graph.

explanations.c: The algorithm needs a stack to store the vertices in the order of their finish times. The stack can have at most n vertices. So the space complexity is O(n).

questions.question: Q3. The Kosaraju's algorithm is used only for directed graphs. True or False?

explanations.b: The algorithm can be used for both directed and undirected graphs. A normal DFS can be only used to find the strongly connected components in an undirected graph.

questions.question: Q4. A graph with n nodes is a DAG (Directed Acyclic Graph), what are the number of strongly connected components in the graph?

explanations.c: Since there are no cycles in the graph, each node is a strongly connected component. So the number of strongly connected components is n.
